“13 Hours: The Secret Soldiers of Benghazi” delivers phenomenal acting and incredible intensity, with action that keeps you on the edge of your seat. The score heightens the experience, and the true story is told in a powerful, compelling way. Overall, it stands out as a favorite and a masterpiece. At its core, the film carries a meaningful message about fulfilling your call to be a warrior until the end—an enriching and transformative reminder of courage and sacrifice.

Going into 13 Hours, I wasn’t expecting more than a run-of-the-mill war/action movie. However, I was pleasantly surprised and ended up really enjoying this film.
What really helps this movie stand out is its core group of protagonists. They’re lively, entertaining, and you genuinely want to see them make it through the ordeal. Michael Bay knows how to shoot action scenes—he always has, even during his Transformers days—and he really gets a chance to shine here.
The film may lose points for those who care about historical accuracy. Personally, that kind of thing doesn’t bother me, but I understand it could be a dealbreaker for some viewers. I also recognize that action movies aren’t everyone’s cup of tea. If you're not into this genre, 13 Hours probably won’t change your mind. But if you enjoy action films, you’ll absolutely love this one.

VERY fast full of action movie and fun direction by M. Bay, once again. Even when at many moments we get lost between places and characters (I guess it blends in with the topic that everybody is lost and confused even within the movie).
On the other hand, the drama was a bit exaggerated and watching Krasinski trying to cry felt like watching Tropic Thunder. Also, the whole ''why are we far from home fighting again in a battle that's not ours'' catharsis, was simply answered with ''money'' in their case (They make it clear at the beginning with the whole jobs back home not paying enough).
All in all, nothing unpredictable but good entertainment for more than 2 hours.

The story, the way it was filmed and depiction of war overall is great, it made me glued to the screen. The characters are pretty cliche, classic army brotherhood style, it's not an innacurate depiction or too over the top but not very original either. All in all it's a solid 7.5/10 and definitely worth a watch.
